intro: Pholiurus incurvus subsp. filiformis, commonly known as the slender leaf pholiurus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to parts of southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its narrow, elongated leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is often found growing on rocky outcrops or in sandy soils, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. The subspecies is noted for its unique morphology and is of interest to botanists studying plant adaptations in dry climates.
